solver.explanations.strategies

Class ConflictBasedBackjumping

  • java.lang.Object
    • solver.explanations.strategies.ConflictBasedBackjumping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IMonitorContradiction, IMonitorSolution, ISearchMonitor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicBacktracking

    public class ConflictBasedBackjumping
extends Object
implements IMonitorContradiction, IMonitorSolution
    This class describes operations to execute to perform Conflict-based back jumping. I reacts on contradictions, by computing the decision to bracktrack to, and on solutions to by explaining the refutation of the decision that leads to the solution.
    Since:
    01/10/12
    Author:
    Charles Prud'homme
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getSolver

        public Solver getSolver()

      • activeUserExplanation

        public void activeUserExplanation(boolean active)
        By activating the user explanation, the algorithm will only store the explanation related to the last conflict. It has a meaning only when the search is complete and has no solution. In that case, the explanation is not composed of any decisions, and the propagators involved explained why there is no solution to the problem.
        Parameters:
        active - true or false

      • getUserExplanation

        public Explanation getUserExplanation()

      • updateVRExplainUponbacktracking

        protected void updateVRExplainUponbacktracking(int nworld,
                                   Explanation expl,
                                   ICause cause)
        Identify the decision to reconsider, and explain its refutation in the explanation data base
        Parameters:
        nworld - index of the world to backtrack to
        expl - explanation of the backtrack
        cause - cause of the failure
